results.content: Der Kurs ist OK bisher. Es gibt aber Beispiele, die schlecht sind. Bspw. ist das Beispiel "https://foo.com/tasks/api/v1/tasks" nicht REST-konform, da zwei Mal "tasks" enthalten ist.

results.content:
Good MOOC. Clear explanations. Good examples. Complete and up to date.
Requires personal work to fully understand, which is normal for a MOOC.
For the course to be even better, just add questions and exercises to test the knowledge.

For the course to be even better, just add questions and exercises to test the knowledge.

results.content: I enjoyed the cookbook style of this course. The style coupled with Luqman Saaeed's straighforward, potent, and clear explanations made these videos really easy to digest and understand. Will definitely use as a reference for creating my own services.
results.content_html: I enjoyed the cookbook style of this course. The style coupled with Luqman Saaeed's straighforward, potent, and clear explanations made these videos really easy to digest and understand. Will definitely use as a reference for creating my own services.

results.content: The code is not well organized, there is not chapters or sections just a bunch of videos not separated... the entire JPA is not working and is unfinished, I'm having problems and sending questions and there are no responses from the creator.

response.content:
Hi and thanks for your custom.
This is a REST web service course, we only cover JPA in so much as it pertains to using it with JAX-RS. If you're looking for an in-depth course on JPA, this isn't the course.
response.content_html:

results.content:
O curso começa bem, porém, o instrutor não aborda, por exemplo, as dependências que devem ser utilizadas. "Apanhei" buscando essa informações no google. Além disso, o curso não apresenta exemplos do mundo real. Por fim, desisti no meio do caminho.


The course was good at the beginning, however, the instructor does not address, for example, the dependencies that should be used. I had to search for this information on google. In addition, the course does not present real-world examples. Finally, I gave up halfway.

response.content:
Hi Glauce, thank you for your review. 

First of all, the entire source code for the course is available on GitHub. You just need to clone it. You don't have to fidget with any dependencies.

Secondly, I'm not sure what you mean by "real world", but the course practically covers what you need to be able to solve your own domain problems, including securing your REST resources with JWT.

All the same thank you for your feedback.
response.content_html:
Hi Glauce, thank you for your review.

First of all, the entire source code for the course is available on GitHub. You just need to clone it. You don't have to fidget with any dependencies.

Secondly, I'm not sure what you mean by "real world", but the course practically covers what you need to be able to solve your own domain problems, including securing your REST resources with JWT.

All the same thank you for your feedback.
